content: Write a sonnet about trees using only words that start with 't'.

Towering trees, their trunks so thick and tough,
Stand tall, their branches touching the sky.
Their leaves, a tapestry of green, enough
To shade the earth from sun's fierce eye.

Thickets of twigs, a tangled treasure trove,
Teem with life, from tiny to large.
The twittering of birds in their haven above,
Tells tales of nature's endless charge.

Through time, they've stood, these titans of wood,
Transcending eras, their growth never ending.
Their roots run deep, a testament to good,
A grounding force, their presence mending.

Though storms may threaten, their strength is true,
Timeless trees, forever growing new.
